Empires & Puzzles Vanya Review: The Steadfast Sapper Guide

Is Vanya just a dwarf with a drill, or the ultimate support hero? We dig into his stats, his massive Mega Minion, and why his 'Sense of Wonder' might be the most confusingly named skill in the game. Find out if this Garrison Guard still holds up!
Vanya: The Drill-Wielding Healer Who Loves Butterflies
Vanya, The Steadfast Sapper: Digging Deep For A Sense of Wonder

Vanya is a 5-star Fire hero from the Garrison Guards family, originally released in April 2024. In a game often dominated by fierce warriors and eldritch horrors, Vanya stands out as a sturdy, support-oriented Monk who brings a unique mix of massive healing and one of the beefiest minions in the game. While he hails from the "Goblin era" of Empires & Puzzles, his role as a "Mega Minion Summoner" keeps him mechanically distinct. He doesn't just heal your team; he builds them a bunker.

Vanya’s visual design is a study in contrasts. On one hand, you have a rugged, bearded dwarf equipped with what appears to be a heavy-duty industrial drill and heavy plating—a sapper ready to breach castle walls. On the other hand, he is gently gazing at a glowing butterfly perched on his hand. This juxtaposition perfectly encapsulates his special skill name, "Sense of Wonder." It’s a delightful, if slightly baffling, artistic choice that suggests beneath that gruff exterior lies a poet's soul... or perhaps he's just easily distracted by shiny flying things while on the battlefield.

When looking at Vanya through the lens of late 2025, his base stats show his age. With a base power of 1075 and stats hovering around the 1100-1126 mark (unbroken), he falls significantly behind the modern titans of the game who boast base stats well over 1300.

However, Vanya is a hero who scales exceptionally well with investment. Because his primary gimmick—the Mega Minion—inherits a percentage of his HP, every point of health you add via Limit Breaking and Emblems pays dividends twice: once for Vanya's survival and once for his minion's tankiness. While his raw numbers are no longer top-tier, his defensive spread allows him to remain a functional damage sponge if fully maxed.
"Sense of Wonder" is a powerhouse support skill, provided you can get it to fire.
Recovering 54% health for all allies is a substantial chunk of HP, rivaling dedicated healers.

This is the main event. A minion with 65% of Vanya's HP is essentially a 6th hero on the board. It acts as a massive meat shield, absorbing thousands of damage points that would otherwise kill your team.
The Mega Minion cleanses status ailments
. This is a "safe cleanse," meaning it bypasses secondary effects that trigger on dispels (like damage on removal), making it incredibly valuable against heroes who punish you for curing yourself.
Let's break down what Vanya brings to the table mathematically.

Slow. He requires 12 tiles to charge. However, his passive grants 5% mana when receiving an ailment. Against dot-heavy or debuff-heavy teams, this can effectively reduce his tile requirement to Average speed (9-10 tiles) in the right conditions.
With a fully maxed build (LB2 + Troops), Vanya can easily reach ~2400-2600 HP. A 54% heal restores roughly
to every ally. That is nearly a full reset for many squishier heroes.
Using that same 2500 HP estimate, the Shield Guard Mega Minion spawns with
. For context, that is more health than many un-emblemed 5-star heroes have in total. It effectively gives Vanya a second health bar.
Family Bonus, Passives, Aether Power & Unique Abilities
The Garrison Guards are built for attrition and sustainability, and Vanya's passives are perfectly tuned to keep him doing his job despite his Slow speed.
The Garrison family bonus generally supports the Mega Minion mechanic, often providing stat boosts or interactions that make these summoned units even more formidable.
This is a top-tier passive. It completely neutralizes mana controllers like Waterpipe or the classic Guanyu, ensuring Vanya charges steadily.

Gaining 5% mana per ailment allows Vanya to punish enemy debuffers. If an enemy hits him with a skill that applies Defense Down, Poison, and Burn, he instantly gains 15% mana. This makes him dangerous to indiscriminately debuff.
Removing Wither effects every 4 turns is a niche but welcome counter to the Goblin and Construct families that rely on permanent stat reduction.

fits Vanya's role as a survivor. While not as flashy as "Revive" or "Defense Up," it adds another layer of sustainability, helping him stay alive long enough to cast his skill and summon his protective minion.

Upon release, Vanya was a monster. His Mega Minion was nearly indestructible for many teams, and he offered a "true counter" to Wither effects. He was a staple in Rush Wars and a formidable tank/flank.

By late 2025 standards, Vanya's direct damage influence is negligible. His stat line has been crept by newer releases with higher base power. The 65% HP inheritance for the minion is still strong, but modern damage dealers hit so hard that even 1600 HP minions can vanish in a turn or two.
Vanya has transitioned from a meta-defining hero to a niche specialist. He remains

in Rush Attack wars and tournaments due to his Slow speed being mitigated. In standard PvP, he is risky; if he fires, you likely win (or stabilize), but getting him to fire before a modern Fast sniper deletes him is the challenge. He is no longer a premier defense hero but is an excellent offensive tool for sustained PvE or war attacks.
At the time of writing, Vanya does not have a costume. This review focuses on his base form.
Vanya is a support hero whose main mechanic (Minion HP) scales directly off his own Health stat. Therefore, there is only one correct way to emblem him.
Maximizes the HP of the Shield Guard Mega Minion. Increases Vanya's survivability, ensuring he lives to cast.
His tile damage and the minion's attack (which is 180% of Vanya's attack) will be slightly lower, but Vanya isn't there to kill things directly.
nodes first, then Defense. Do not be tempted by Attack nodes for the minion damage; a dead Vanya summons no minions.
The combination of a 54% heal and a massive Mega Minion effectively doubles the team's durability.
, meaning Vanya continues to support the team even if he is silenced or mana-controlled after casting.
Innate resistance to mana cuts makes him reliable against controllers.
Gains mana when enemies try to weaken him.
Without Rush mechanics or mana troops, 12 tiles is an eternity in the modern fast-paced meta.
Heroes who destroy minions (e.g., Grimsteel, Ogima, or newer Lunar heroes) or prevent minion summoning completely shut him down.
His lower defense stat by 2025 standards means he can take massive damage from tile cascades before he gets his protection up.
This is his playground. At Very Fast speed, he is a nightmare to deal with.
His overheal potential (via the minion acting as a shield) and cleanse make him great for long, grueling climbs.
The Mega Minion can solo many bosses if the rest of the team dies.
Vanya works best when you can cheat his mana speed or when he is protecting high-value glass cannons.
Vanya - Hathor - Phoenix (or other distinct red healer)
. Using Vanya alongside another overhealer creates a team with essentially infinite HP, perfect for waiting out enemies.
. Putting Vanya next to a taunter like Ludwig allows him to charge quickly and set up his defensive bunker.
Any hero that "Destroys all Minions" before dealing damage is Vanya's nemesis.
Newer heroes often have "anti-summon" capabilities or punish you for having minions.
While he resists mana cuts, he can still be silenced or blocked.

If you pulled Vanya early in your journey, rejoice! He will carry you through almost every map stage and quest. His Mega Minion is likely stronger than your other heroes. Max him immediately and use him as your tank or flank. He solves the two biggest problems for new players: staying alive and dealing with status ailments.

Vanya is a luxury tool for your war depth, specifically for Rush Wars. Unless you are lacking healers, he likely won't make your primary defense team in the 2025 meta. However, he is worth keeping for those specific wars where minion summoners are banned or Rush rules apply. He is not a high priority for Alpha Aethers unless you really love the Garrison family playstyle.
The community's reaction to Vanya has always been a mix of awe at his minion size and confusion at his flavor text.
Players were famously perplexed by the skill name. One forum user noted,
"Am I the only one here who thinks his skill name is so bizarre? I see no connection at all... looking like warrior but is a healer."
There was considerable discussion regarding the "safe cleanse" wording. It was clarified that
"safely cleanse bypasses secondary effects, such as damage on removal,"
which settled debates on whether he triggered traps left by certain ailment-givers.
Upon release, players celebrated him as a
thanks to his Guard Rally passive, which was a hot topic during the Goblin meta dominance.

Vanya is a hero who proves that sometimes, the best offense is a really, really thick defense. While his stats have gathered a bit of dust compared to the shiny new toys of late 2025, his mechanics remain fundamentally sound. A healing miner who summons a bodyguard with the health pool of a tank is never useless. He might not be the fastest drill in the shed, but once he gets going, he is very hard to stop.
A retired meta-tank who enjoys a comfortable semi-retirement dominating Rush Wars.
